title: React v15.0.0-rc1 issue in IE11: Unable to get property 'nextSibling' of undefined or null reference
body:
Don't know yet exactly what causes this, so I'll update the ticket if I find out more. For now I do got a long stack trace: ``` getNativeNode [Line: 140, Col: 1], ReactDOMTextComponent.js ReactReconciler.getNativeNode [Line: 54, Col: 1], ReactReconciler.js Col: 1], ReactUpdates.js flushBatchedUpdates [Line: 164, Col: 1], ReactUpdates.js wrapper [Line: 66, Col: 1], ReactPerf.js Mixin.closeAll [Line: 202, Col: 1], Transaction.js Mixin.perform [Line: 149, Col: 1], Transaction.js ReactDefaultBatchingStrategy.batchedUpdates [Line: 62, Col: 1], ReactDefaultBatchingStrategy.js enqueueUpdate [Line: 193, Col: 1], ReactUpdates.js enqueueUpdate [Line: 22, Col: 1], ReactUpdateQueue.js ReactUpdateQueue.enqueueCallback [Line: 106, Col: 1], ReactUpdateQueue.js ReactComponent.prototype.setState [Line: 69, Col: 1], ReactComponent.js setPage [Line: 56, Col: 9], page-container.js openPage [Line: 244, Col: 9], navigation.js doOpenPage [Line: 82, Col: 13], router.js flushQueue [Line: 13, Col: 9], nexttick.js Anonymous function [Line: 36, Col: 13], nexttick.js ``` The `setState()` call from `setPage()` at page-container.js:56 (this is where the stack trace enters React.js code) looks like this: ``` this.setState({ PageClass: PageClass, pageProps: pageProps }, () => callback(this.refs.page); ``` The render method of this PageContainer component looks as follows (simplified): ``` const { PageClass, pageProps } = this.state; pageProps.ref = 'page'; return
{React.createElement(PageClass, pageProps)}
; ``` This code works fine in Chrome, but fails in IE11. I'll try to see if I can make a minimal example displaying the problem.
